Container.Name: deepstack
Container.Overview: DeepStack is an AI server that empowers every developer in the world to easily build state-of-the-art AI systems both on premise and in the cloud. The promises of Artificial Intelligence are huge but becoming a machine learning engineer is hard. Build and deploy AI powered applications with in-built and custom AI APIs, all offline and self-hosted. See https://deepstack.cc [br] [br] To use with home assistant see: https://github.com/robmarkcole/HASS-Deepstack-object#hass-deepstack-object [br] [br] [b][u][span style='color: #E80000;']Old CPUs without AVX[/span][/u][/b] [br] If you are using an older cpu that dosn't support AVX add [b]:noavx[/b] to the end of the [b]"Repository:"[/b] field (switch on advanced view). [br] Should look like this: [b]deepquestai/deepstack:noavx[/b] [br] [br] [b][u][span style='color: #E80000;']Nvidia GPU Use[/span][/u][/b] [br] Install Unraid Nvidia Plugin to install Nvidia Drivers: [b]https://forums.unraid.net/topic/98978-plugin-nvidia-driver/[/b] [br] Add [b]:gpu[/b] to the end of the [b]"Repository:"[/b] field (switch on advanced view). Should look like this: [b]deepquestai/deepstack:gpu[/b] [br] Add [b]--runtime=nvidia[/b] to the [b]"Extra Parameters:"[/b] field (switch on advanced view) . [br] Copy your [b]GPU UUID[/b] to [b]NVIDIA_VISIBLE_DEVICES.[/b]
Container.Description: DeepStack is an AI server that empowers every developer in the world to easily build state-of-the-art AI systems both on premise and in the cloud. The promises of Artificial Intelligence are huge but becoming a machine learning engineer is hard. Build and deploy AI powered applications with in-built and custom AI APIs, all offline and self-hosted. See https://deepstack.cc [br] [br] To use with home assistant see: https://github.com/robmarkcole/HASS-Deepstack-object#hass-deepstack-object [br] [br] [b][u][span style='color: #E80000;']Old CPUs without AVX[/span][/u][/b] [br] If you are using an older cpu that dosn't support AVX add [b]:noavx[/b] to the end of the [b]"Repository:"[/b] field (switch on advanced view). [br] Should look like this: [b]deepquestai/deepstack:noavx[/b] [br] [br] [b][u][span style='color: #E80000;']Nvidia GPU Use[/span][/u][/b] [br] Install Unraid Nvidia Plugin to install Nvidia Drivers: [b]https://forums.unraid.net/topic/98978-plugin-nvidia-driver/[/b] [br] Add [b]:gpu[/b] to the end of the [b]"Repository:"[/b] field (switch on advanced view). Should look like this: [b]deepquestai/deepstack:gpu[/b] [br] Add [b]--runtime=nvidia[/b] to the [b]"Extra Parameters:"[/b] field (switch on advanced view) . [br] Copy your [b]GPU UUID[/b] to [b]NVIDIA_VISIBLE_DEVICES.[/b]

Config.Name: WebUI
Config.Description: For access to the Web UI and API. Default is 5000.

Config.Name: Object Detection
Config.Description: This enables the object detection API. Default is False. (VISION-DETECTION)

Config.Name: Face Detection
Config.Description: This enables the face recognition APIs. Default is False. (VISION-FACE)

Config.Name: Scene Detection
Config.Description: This enables the scene recognition API. Default is False. (VISION-SCENE)

Config.Name: Performance Mode
Config.Description: DeepStack offers three modes allowing you to tradeoff speed for performance. You can specify performance mode to be High, Medium and Low. Default is Medium. (MODE)

Config.Name: API Key
Config.Description: API Key used to protect your api endpoint to prevent unauthorized access. (API-KEY)

Config.Name: Admin Key
Config.Description: The Admin Key protects admin APIs such as adding models, deleting models, list models, backup and restore. (ADMIN-KEY)

Config.Name: Nvidia Visible Devices
Config.Description: Requires Nvidia GPU and Unraid Nvidia drivers. (NVIDIA_VISIBLE_DEVICES)

Config.Name: Nvidia Driver Capabilities
Config.Description: Requires Nvidia GPU and Unraid Nvidia drivers. Default is all. (NVIDIA_DRIVER_CAPABILITIES)
